page.title: 17Grouse Shooting & Stalking
page.content: On the 12th of August the grouse shooting starts. The landowners, guests and gamekeepers assemble with their dogs,guns and C.B. radios and set off for the hill on an eight wheeled machine called an Argo. This takes them to a known spot where grouse are often seen. The stalkers with their dogs flush out the grouse from their hiding places. After the grouse shooting the stalking of the red deer begins and people again climb into their Argos.It is less sporting than it used to be. Formerly they had to walk for miles in the hills with their ponies carrying the shot deer. After the deer are brought back to the larder the gamekeepers skin the bodies.Afterwards they are sold to a game dealer. Most of the venison is sent to the continent.
